description: From Middle English bulb, bolbe, from Latin bulbus (“bulb, onion”), from Ancient Greek βολβός (bolbós, “plant with round swelling on underground stem”).

entries.meaning: The bulb-shaped root portion of a plant such as a tulip, from which the rest of the plant may be regrown.
examples: the plants which grow in the earth from seed or bulbs.

definitionGroups.group: Any solid object rounded at one end and tapering on the other, possibly attached to a larger object at the tapered end.

entries.meaning: A light bulb (not necessarily bulbous in shape).
examples: An incandescent bulb; an LED bulb; a fluorescent tube bulb

entries.meaning: (nautical) A bulbous protuberance at the forefoot of certain vessels to reduce turbulence.

verbs.description: bulb (third-person singular simple present bulbs, present participle bulbing, simple past and past participle bulbed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To take the shape of a bulb; to swell.
